title: 20 Comfort Foods All Yalies Love
author: Diane Kim
text:
Late night study breaks, post-Toads drunchies … we’ve all been there. What would we do without our favorite comfort foods to get us through our worst? So calorie-filled, but so-good, you can never go wrong these New Haven classics.

1. Pad Thai, Pad Thai Restaurant
Ugh those sticky, peanutty noodles of perfection though. A “late-night Pad Thai” joint on Church Street would be greatly appreciated.


source: tripadvisor.com

2. Falafels, Mamoun’s
Add the famous Mamoun’s hot sauce and wow. Who cares if you’ve got falafel stains smeared all over your face?


source: files.nyu.edu

3. Milkshakes at Yorkside
Uh, yes I can finish this huge, luscious, milky goodness all by myself, thank you very much. Go get your own.


source: Diane Kim

4. Bacon, Egg, & Cheese at Gourmet Heaven
The reason why Adam knows me way too well. Gheav’s crispy, yolky, cheesy, and ridiculously delicious masterpiece.


source: Diane Kim

5. Drunken Noodle, Thai Taste
Just can’t get enough of those voluptuous noodles doused in rich spices and fatty grease-- I know you fantasize about this too.


source: yelp.com

6. Ice Cream Sandwich, Insomnia Cookies
Two heavenly Insomnia cookies baked out of the oven, sandwiching smooth, creamy ice cream into a concoction that melts straight into your mouth. #YES


source: pinterest.com

7. White Clam Pizza, Pepe’s
If you’re willing to walk all the way to Pepe’s to get me this pizza, I will shower you with love forever.


source: Diane Kim

8. Mozzerella Sticks, Branford Buttery
Okay, shameless residential college promotion here. But Branford truly does mozz sticks right by using a fryer, not a microwave, and offering an assortment of ranch, barbecue sauce, and ketchup that completes this experience.


Source: Diane Kim

9. Nachos, Tomatillo
For those of you who are nacho enthusiasts (aka everyone), you’ll be pleased to find that Tomatillo nachos will have you fighting over this lovely mess of guac, salsa, beans, and, obviously, cheese.


source: chewhaven.com

10. Wenzel, Alpha Delta Pizza
They ship these things across the world; that’s how good they are. Enough said.


source: Diane Kim

11. Wonton Soup, Ivy Noodle
So many reasons to worship Ivy Noodle. This wonton soup, with its strong broth and little baby packages of meat, tops the list.


source: yelp.com

12. Crazy Roll, Sushi on Chapel
If you haven’t tried the crazy roll from Sushi on Chapel, then get your butt over there right now. This shrimp and avocado fest will make you question everything you’ve ever thought about life.


source: Diane Kim

13. Anything Fried, Yorkside Pizza
Can’t decide whether to get the giant mozz sticks, greasy onion rings, scrumptiously fried zucchini, or good ole french fries? Neither can I-- just get’em all.


Source: Diane Kim

14. Wings, S’wings
Oops, didn’t mean to drool all over my keyboard. My mouth just automatically salivates when I think about these spicy, tender wings.


source: yelp.com

15. Burgers, Prime 16
I’m convinced that if there were as many Prime 16s as there were Shake Shacks, all the world’s problems would go away. Also, thank god for late night prices of $5.


source: prime16.com

16. Froyo, Froyoworld
Not gonna lie; my inner fat kid leaps for joy when Froyoworld does its $5, fill-as-much-as-you-want deal. I’m kind of addicted to mochi balls and chocolate pretzels.


source: newyorkstreetfood.com

17. Garlic Naan, Zaroka
Look at the the beautiful sprinkled garlic delicately on top of one of the world’s most wonderful carbs. Doesn’t it just bring you to tears?


source: lovers-of-food.blogspot.com

18. Arepas, Rubamba
This is literally the only reason why I carry cash. Corn and cheese meet in the best way possible topped with tangy sauce and succulent mini shrimp.


source: Diane Kim

19. Cupcakes, Katalina
Shoutout to the best cupcake place in town. Katalina hits the spot with these impossibly soft cupcakes with quality whipped cream.


source: katalinasbakery.com

20. Grilled Cheese, Caseus Food Truck
Caseus takes mankind’s greatest invention, the grilled cheese sandwich, to another level with its own delectable, heart-stopping recipe.


source: foodtrucktalk.com


Add on to the list by telling us your favorite late night snacks in the comments section below!
summary: Late night study breaks, post-Toads drenchies … we’ve all been there.  What would we do without our favorite comfort foods to get us through our worst? So calorie-filled, but so-good, these New Haven classics never go wrong.
